pages.title: ℧ Five of Cups ℧
pages.text: Spirit of Loss in Pleasure$(br)     ♂ Mars in ♏ Scorpio

A dark, cloaked figure, looking sideways at three prone cups, and what looks like red liquid all around them; two other cups stand upright behind him.$(br)  A bridge is in the background, leading to a small keep or holding.$(br)  Red suggests blood, and when we see it spilled, it recalls a traditional symbol of lost innocence.$(br)  We also might think of the red as wine, in which case we have lost the abundance and

luxury of previous ventures.$(br)  It is a card of exchange not corresponding to expectations; after the sorrow of losing grandeur or abundance, we may return to a sense of what really matters to us.$(br)  The two standing cups also may signify what is really important, in other words, what is not lost so easily.$(br)  The addition of the second unspilled cup could symbolize something new and positive that has come into our lives during a time of sorrow.
$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Loss, sorrow, deep emotion.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Understanding, fresh hope, an appreciation for what remains or returns, or else something new and hopeful.
